titlestmt.titleproper: RG 074:043, Rollin Germain Hubby Genealogical Papers
titlestmt.subtitle: Inventory
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Connecticut State Library staff.

publicationstmt.p: Copyright Â© 2009 by the Connecticut State Library

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Damon M. Munz on >March 06, 2009

did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.abstract: Includes genealogical charts, records, correspondence of Hobby and allied families, 1200-1933.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Rollin Germain Hubby compiled information about the Hobby family from around 1903 through 1930. For many of those years he lived in Cleveland, but when he joined the New England Genealogical Society in 1929, he was living in Hollywood, California. In March 1904, Hubby sent out a bulletin announcing that a Hobby Genealogy was being prepared and soliciting information for it. In 1910, his intention for a Hobby Genealogy was announced in New England...Register.
Source: Josephine W. Beers letter to Frances Davenport, February, 1, 1979, State Archives RG 074 files.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Includes genealogical charts, records, correspondence of Hobby and allied families, 1200-1933.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: These records are stored at an off-site facility and therefore may not be available on a same-day basis.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The papers came to the Connecticut State Library in February 1979 from Josephine W. Beers.

did.unittitle: Letters: Miscellaneous - unidentified Hobbys and others
Letters and data of Dr. C.M. Hobby of Iowa City, Iowa

note.p: Dr. Hobby was very enthusiastic over the family history, and a great student of history. A large amount of the data sent in his letters was written from memory, and as he did not give references as to his sources of information, it has been impossible to verify much of it. Until such data has been verified it cannot be accepted as authentic, but the letters have been preserved in hope that the statements made therein can be verified at some future date.

scopecontent.p: Contains: William O. Hobby, Police Commissioner; Major Hobby, Assistant Postmaster General; Hon. William R. Hobbie, Assemblyman (N.Y.).
Contains: Leander M. Hubby.
